INDUSTRY PUBLICATIONS






EU Full Market Opening: The End of the Beginning (UtiliPoint.com - Jul. 2, 2007) 



UtiliPoint.com - Jul. 2, 2007 - It is now July and the deadline for full energy retail market opening in the European Union (EU) has passed, yet the European Commission's desired goal of a single, efficiently functioning European energy market remains a distant possibility rather than an imminent actuality.

NATIONAL NEWS






Follow procedure to restore natural gas, electric service



Jul. 1--NorthWestern Energy natural gas and electric customers in Aberdeen must take specific precautions and repairs before services can be restored after the flood.  NorthWestern Energy spokesman Tom Glanzer said that as of Thursday, 90 natural gas and 24 electric customers were without services. According to a press release from NorthWestern Energy, customers need to replace all natural gas ...


Jul 1, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Ontelaunee Energy Center feeding need for power: Dynegy Inc.'s five-year-old plant generates up to 580 megawatts.



Jul. 1--It's Berks County's newest power plant and, at 580 megawatts, the county's largest in terms of electrical generating capacity.  "To put that into perspective, that's about 500,000 homes that we can power," said Joseph C. Lloyd, plant manager of Ontelaunee Energy Center, which went online in 2002. Located at 5115 Pottsville Pike, or Route 61, in Ontelaunee Township, the plant is fueled by ...


Jul 1, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



NEW: Brief power outage affects 5,500



Jul. 2--The 5,500 Howard County residents who lost power Monday morning have a squirrel to thank.  "Believe it or not, that's not that uncommon," said Duke Energy spokeswoman Angeline Protogere. "A squirrel interfered with some of the equipment," she said. The squirrel caused a power shortage at one of the substations located at 401 S. Main St., Protogere said.


Jul 2, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Week in review: Syntroleum, Tyson to build fuels plant: Tulsa-area apartment market tightens



Jul. 1--Occupancies are  up across the board at Tulsa-area apartments. A midyear survey by CB Richard Ellis/Oklahoma shows that the average complex is 92.5 percent full, which erased a dip to 91.5 at the start of the year. And that's driving up rent at a rapid pace, as the average monthly bill has increased $10 to $14 per month over the last six months and reached record highs for the area, said ...


Jul 1, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News





Agency: Power Plant Contracts Should Be Rejected



A state agency that represents electric ratepayers says a series of contracts to help pay for new power plant construction should be rejected because the contracts could cost ratepayers nearly $2 billion, and are not cost effective. The four power projects selected by state regulators in April are designed to save ratepayers money over the next 15 years by helping to create new generation ...


Jul 2, 2007 Hartford Courant



A Very Good Year for Wind Energy



The American Wind Energy Association is predicting a  record-breaking year in 2005. The association says there is 2,500 megawatt (MW) of capacity planned for installation, far more than the industry's record of 1,696 MW in 2001. One MW of wind capacity generates as much electricity as that used by about 300 households. The association's prediction means as many as 750,000 homes could be served by ...

Spectra Energy Honors Employee Achievement With First Summit Awards Recognition



HOUSTON, July 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Spectra Energy has selected 26 employees as winners of the company's first Summit Award recognition program. The honorees were recognized for their outstanding actions and visionary thinking in the areas of Safety, Stewardship, Integrity, Respect, Initiative, Performance and Relationships.

Dominion Completes Merger of CNG Subsidiary Into Holding Company



RICHMOND, Va., July 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Dominion (NYSE: D) announced today that it has completed the merger of its wholly owned subsidiary, Consolidated Natural Gas Company, into the parent holding company, Dominion Resources, Inc., as part of a move to streamline its corporate structure. The merger was effective at 12:01 a.m. on Saturday, June 30.

Perry Enters Outage for Maintenance Work



NORTH PERRY, Ohio, July 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- FirstEnergy Nuclear Operating Company (FENOC) announced today that work began over the weekend at the Perry Nuclear Power Plant to replace a motor in the Reactor Recirculation System. The 20-ton motor is one of two motors in the system that controls the flow of water to the reactor vessel, allowing plant operators to raise and lower reactor ...

AMP-Ohio Joins Prairie State Energy Campus Partner Group With Commitment to 300 Megawatts of the Project

LOUIS, July 2 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- The Prairie State Energy Campus today announced that it has entered into an agreement with American Municipal Power-Ohio (AMP-Ohio) with a commitment to 300 megawatts of the project. Range Fuels Awarded Permit to Construct the Nation's First Commercial Cellulosic Ethanol Plant - Groundbreaking to Happen This Summer



Range Fuels announced today that the company was awarded a construction permit from the state of Georgia to build the first commercial-scale cellulosic ethanol plant in the United States. Ground breaking will take place this summer in Treutlen County, Georgia for a 100-million-gallon-per-year cellulosic ethanol plant that will use wood waste from Georgia's forests as its feedstock.

CPS Energy agrees to buy natural gas at a discount



CPS Energy has entered into a long-term natural gas supply agreement that is projected to save gas customers in excess of $100 million on their utility bills over the next 20 years. Avista Completes Sale of Avista Energy Trading Subsidiary to Shell Subsidiary



- 3:07 p.m. SPOKANE, Wash. (AP) - Avista Corp. said Monday it closed the sale of its energy trading subsidiary to Shell subsidiary Coral Energy Holding LP. Avista said it plans to use most of the $175 million generated from the deal and the pending liquidation of some other assets to invest in its utility business. The sale included most of the contracts and operations of the Avista Energy ...

Nuclear Energy Using New Momentum to Take on Old Obstacles



Jay Lindsay BOSTON (AP) - Thanks to global warming, nuclear energy is hot again. Its promise of abundant, carbon emissions-free power is being pushed by the president and newly considered by environmentalists. But any expansion won't come cheap or easy. The enormous obstacles facing nuclear power are the same as they were in 1996, when the nation's last new nuclear plant opened near the Watts Bar ...

Kinder Sells Natural Gas Pipeline to Oneok for $300 Million



HOUSTON (AP) - Kinder Morgan Energy Partners LP on Monday agreed to sell a gas pipeline system from Kansas to Chicago to Oneok Partners LP for $300 million. Kinder said it the system is no longer a strategic asset. The company plans to use the money for other parts of its energy business. Oneok confirmed the terms of the deal in a separate release. Oil back above $71



NEW YORK (Reuters) -- Oil prices rose to 10-month highs above $71 on Monday on expectations that recovering refinery operations in the United States and ongoing supply restrictions will cut into global oil inventories.
